evidence: We hypothesize that curriculum learning has both an effect on the speed of convergence of the training process to a minimum and , in the case of non-convex criteria , on the quality of the local minima obtained : curriculum learning can be seen as a particular form of continuation method ( a general strategy for global optimization of non-convex functions ) .
text: We hypothesize that curriculum learning has both an effect on the speed of convergence of the training process to a minimum and , in the case of non-convex criteria , on the quality of the local minima obtained : curriculum learning can be seen as a particular form of continuation method ( a general strategy for global optimization of non-convex functions ) .
